001package org.consensusj.rx.zeromq;
002
003import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.BackpressureStrategy;
004import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Flowable;
005import io.reactivex.rxjava3.disposables.Disposable;
006import io.reactivex.rxjava3.processors.FlowableProcessor;
007import io.reactivex.rxjava3.processors.PublishProcessor;
008import org.reactivestreams.Subscriber;
009import org.slf4j.Logger;
010import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
011import org.zeromq.SocketType;
012import org.zeromq.ZContext;
013import org.zeromq.ZMQ;
014import org.zeromq.ZMsg;
015
016import java.io.Closeable;
017import java.net.URI;
018import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
019import java.util.List;
020import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
021import java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory;
022
023/**
024 * ZMQ Context with a single socket and one {@code FlowableProcessor<ZMsg>} per topic.
025 * It subscribes {@code SUB} to one or more topics using ZMQ and receives a multiplexed
026 * stream of {@link ZMsg} from the ZMsgSocketFlowable. In {@link RxZmqContext#onNext} the ZMsg
027 * are de-multiplexed by the {@code topic} {@code String} and placed in a per-topic
028 * {@code FlowableProcessor<ZMsg>}.
029 * <p>
030 * Topics (at least for now) must be passed to the constructor.
031 * It would be nice to be able to subscribe to topics at the ZMQ level when we first get
032 * subscriptions at the Rx level. This will probably require using a ZPoller or something like that.
033 */
034public class RxZmqContext implements Closeable {
035    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(RxZmqContext.class);
036    private final ZContext zContext;
037    private final Disposable disposable;
038
039    // Map of topic names to per-topic FlowableProcessor
040    private final ConcurrentHashMap<String, FlowableProcessor<ZMsg>> processors = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
041
042    public RxZmqContext(URI tcpAddress, List<String> topics) {
043        this(tcpAddress, topics, (Runnable r) -> new Thread(r, "ZeroMQ Subscriber"));
044    }
045
046    public RxZmqContext(URI tcpAddress, List<String> topics, ThreadFactory threadFactory) {
047        zContext = new ZContext();
048        //  Socket to talk to server
049        log.info("Connecting to Zmq server at: {}", tcpAddress);
050
051        ZMQ.Socket socket = zContext.createSocket(SocketType.SUB);
052        socket.connect(tcpAddress.toString());
053
054        topics.forEach(topic -> {
055            log.info("Subscribing to topic: {}", topic);
056            this.addTopic(topic);
057            socket.subscribe(topic);
058        });
059
060        disposable = ZMsgSocketFlowable.createFromSocket(socket, BackpressureStrategy.LATEST, threadFactory)
061                .subscribe(this::onNext, this::onError, this::onComplete);
062        log.info("Connected.. Waiting for subscribers.");
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Get a Publisher (Flowable) for a given topic
067     *
068     * @param topic a valid topic as passed to the constructor
069     * @return A Publisher (Flowable) for the topic
070     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if topic wasn't configured in the constructor
071     */
072    public Flowable<ZMsg> topicPublisher(String topic) {
073        Flowable<ZMsg> flowable = processors.get(topic);
074        if (flowable == null) {
075            throw new IllegalArgumentException("topic unavailable -- topics must be passed to constructor");
076        }
077        return flowable;
078    }
079
080    @Override
081    public void close() {
082        disposable.dispose();
083        zContext.close();
084    }
085
086    private void onNext(ZMsg zMsg) {
087        // Deliver message to correct processor for topic
088        String topic = zMsg.getFirst().getString(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
089        Subscriber<ZMsg> subscriber = processors.get(topic);
090        subscriber.onNext(zMsg);
091    }
092
093    private void onError(Throwable throwable) {
094        // Propagate upstream onError to all downstream
095        processors.values().forEach(p -> p.onError(throwable));
096    }
097
098    private void onComplete() {
099        // Propagate upstream onComplete to all downstream
100        processors.values().forEach(Subscriber::onComplete);
101    }
102
103    private void addTopic(String topic) {
104        processors.computeIfAbsent(topic, t -> PublishProcessor.create());
105    }
106}
